clinical_study.brief_title: Microwave Coagulation Using CROMA Electrosurgical System
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of the Safety and Performance of Microwave Coagulation by the CROMA Electrosurgical System During Resection of Complex Colorectal Polyps

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single centre, prospective, non-randomised pivotal clinical investigation to be undertaken at St Mark's Hospital, Harrow, UK.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will recruit 30 patients undergoing endoscopic resection of complex colorectal polyps and be used to demonstrate safety and performance of the CROMA Electrosurgical System microwave coagulation modality. Study data will complement existing data to support a CE marking application for the CROMA Electrosurgical System (combined RF and microwave modalities).

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety: assessed using reported Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Safety will be assessed using reported Adverse Events up to 28w post-operatively
The proportion of patients with intra-operative complications will be reported
The proportion of patients with post-procedural complications will be reported
The proportion of patients that go on to require further surgery during the immediate post-operative and follow up periods will be reported
